title: Is Illaoi's E unfair or just unknown?
body:
I'm hardly a high elo player, nor am i an expert but recently ive seen so many youtubers such as Gbay99, Redmercy and some others have commented on the fact that her E has no counterplay.

Ive been maining top lane since Season 3 dropping support in Season 2, mixing it up with Season 4 with a bit of both and moving back to top alot more in Season 5, but i digress, playing against Illaoi has been one of the easiest matchups ive had, her Q is easily dodged if paying close attention her W is only strong with tentacles and to the point of this discussion, her E is somewhat average and easy to play around.

I hope to avoid "its because the Illaoi wasn't very good" as its honestly a cop out answer.

Overall i feel she isnt op, she has a beast teamfight, but only if you let her set it up, she has a somewhat average lane as her sustain and damage are directly linked to her tentacles which she only has limited control over and the tentacles spawned with E are so predictable you can simply dodge them with little effort since your movement directs where they swing making her a predictable and exploitable but very powerful if not respected.

I hope to get some great insight and opinions on her :)

replies.body:
My quarrel with her E is that there is nothing you can do that isn't what she wants,

If she kills your spirit, you get heaps of damage and spawn damaging tentacles.

If you walk out of the radius you spawn damaging tentacles 

Your only option is to jump on her and deal damage to make your spirit go away faster, but this is a horrible counterplay strategy because she is an AD TANK, so like all tanks, jumping on her is the very thing she wants most, plus she is AD and so does more damage to you than usual tanks, plus if you jump on her while she is attacking the spirit, you just get damaged twice as both you and your spirit get hit by her kit (which only consists of AoE abilities) and if she ults while you are attacking her during the spirit thing she spawns a tenctale from BOTH you and your spirit, so of the 3, attacking her is the worst option.

so apart from not getting hit by it, i don't see any counterplay, and 'not getting hit by it' is not an adequate answer at all. 

im not saying she is op or broken or weak, she hasn't been around long enough for me to have a solid option, but from what i can see there is no counterplay on her E. 
i like her as a champ tho
If you poke her from a distance when she draws your spirit out, you can avoid entirely the whole taking extreme amounts of damage issue.

assuming you are playing a champion with decent poke, 
if you need a certain type of champion to do it, then it doesn't really count as counterplay, its just counter picking in draft or dumb luck in blind pick.

That's typically how the game is played. Each champion has their weaknesses and you are perfectly set to pick against those weaknesses.

And besides, no point complaining about dumb luck in blind pick when soon OCE wont even have Blind Pick.

My point was there is a difference between counterplay and counter picking,

counter-picking happens in champ select and counter playing happens in game, even if you are playing against a champion that counters you, you can still counterplay them but its just harder. 

If counter picking was the only counterplay a champ could have then if that champ picked after their lane opponent then game over.
hence there needs to be counterplay, for example: Zed can leap over Azir's wall with his W and R, and so regardless of which champ counters the other, Zed can wait for Azir to ult and then W-R over it, likewise an Azir can wait for zed to use his ult then use his wall. Both can play against each other countering each other abilities. With Illaoi's E theres none of that, she doesn't have to wait for anything and she isn't disadvantaged if it misses.

say gnar for example, even though its a massively spammable ability, He cant just shoot out his boomerang willy-nilly, he needs to think about catching it again, because if he doesn't, not only does he lose his only CC and this is left more vulnerable, he loses a large portion of his sustained damage, so a lane opponent will wait for him to shoot it out and then go in on him, making him jump to safety and then he loses his boomerang for a significant amount of time. So even if he is vsing someone who he counter picked he cant just randomly toss his boomerang or use his leap every time its off cooldown, because that gives his opponent a chance for counterplay. Illaoi needs this on her E.

She really doesn't need any mechanical changes at all. Really just some number changes.
As it currently stands she's highly hit and miss.

If she doesn't get fed early she is utterly useless later in the game.
Especially if she doesn't manage to catch up before someone gets a Mortal Reminder. Once that happens she'll never catch back up and it's all over for her.

Counter picking is a major flavour for LoL.

Why is Lissandra super popular right now?
Because Yasuo is "overpowered" currently.

Why did Morgana become so popular and impactful that she got the Victorious Skin in season four?
Because she counters Thresh and Leona who were very popular at the start of the season.

Why am I playing Jayce so much right now?
Because he counters champs like Olaf who love to stick to you as they attack.

The game is all about winning in champ select, and has been for a long time.
Counterplay and Counterpicking are two sides of the same coin.

While i cant deny that most games are won/lost in champ select, that isn't all there is too it. 
sure morgana was powerful but items like banshees and tenacity boots, provided counterplay because she relied on keeping you in one place for a long time and so struggled if you blocked or reduced it, and her Q skillshot was slow giving people room to avoid it (because if it hit you, RIP) which is again allowing for counterplay, 
Illaoi has none of that, tenacity doesn't affect any part of her E except the 2 second slow, Banshees blocks it but doesn't ruin her combo completely if it does, like it does for morg. 

i know how important champ select is but if that was the only thing, then thats all the game would be, as soon as all the champs are picked one team instantly wins and then you go back to searching for the next game.

Morgana's Q Dark Binding was not why she was popular.
She was popular because of her E Black Shield, which utterly countered the abilities of popular lock down supports like Thresh and Leona.
For the first half of Season 4 Leona and Thresh were picked almost every game, and so Morgana became popular because of her E, not Q.
It just so happens the only part of her anyone complains about is her Q.
I never said it was why she was popular, i said it had counterplay.

do you think her E is a bit too easy for her too spam because she has no downside to spamming it all day, 1 minute curse/30 seconds if you kill the tentacles for a 12 - 8 second cooldown

i most of the time if im renekton usually i can just dash onto her combo and run and win the trade out but i usually just avoid the damage and run out of range otherwise.

who do you play?  if you dont mind me asking, i mostly play gnar and renekton against her and have found them to be really strong.

ive found sion works well enough against her, with his shield and decent timed q's she can barely touch your HP through your spirit, even when she does wail on your spirit just walk out of the field, then use your shield before the damage is transferred to you

i do think one thing about her needs to be changed though, you should be able to interrupt her Q (like sions) doing that will open counter plays against her

even if she seems spamtastic she still has mana and no shield (fk you riven) so dodge and punish works with the nimbler champs

I think it is too easy to spam. Because it doesn't have any defensive purpose (unlike most engages) she doesn't need to save it incase of ganks, unlike renekton/gnar, imagine if their leaps could be used without risk every time they came off cooldown.

My main (and safe) top champs are Gnar, Vlad, Quinn. 
Those champs because of their range tend to do quite well because its significantly less risky to take down her tentacles, and they all have pretty good sustain, Especially Vlad and his pool counters her ultimate, although if you miss-time your E as Quinn and get jumped on.. 
good luck...
If she is top then once behind it can be very hard, because the opponent just has to defend the spirit and put enough pressure that she can kill it

I think she's weak in the laning phase, I've been playing her as sup and she's pretty good because I don't have to worry about my damage output. I do use my e though to deny farming, which works most of the time, except when there's a Morgana sup or Sivir ADC (had both last night, damn shields). When she is OP is in a team fight. As sup, I landed my ulti on all five, got an instant tripple and 1 second later the other two died with assists (just missed the penta).

I agree her laning is weak, but if you proc ult with her spirit from e as well 6 tentacles teamfights over

you aim the adc with your E or the support? i vsd am illaoi sup yesterday and felt she was a bit too easy to push around while i was thresh.

i can see her viability in bot, but mostly with adc's like trist or sivir with a strong escape because she lacks cc, but shes threatening enough to 1v1 the enemy ad.

Depends who the sup is, if they have a heal such as Janna, then I target the sup first, otherwise it's ADC first.  I agree, she works best with Tristana, Sivir and Lucian who can all escape more easily than others - else, I play blitz :D
